importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date marks the conclusion of Game 6 in the ALCS, setting the stage for Game 7 and the potential World Series matchup.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline from Game 6 to Game 7 represents the culmination of a dramatic postseason battle, with the Blue Jays securing a spot in the World Series.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the 2025 postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0.
The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2, forcing a decisive Game 7 in the ALCS.
Seattle's season-high three fielding errors — including two in the second inning — contributed to the loss.
The Mariners' pitcher Yesevage threw a season-high 31 splitters, allowing only six hits and three walks, showcasing composure under pressure.
This is the second Game 7 the Blue Jays have played in franchise history and their first since 1985.
The winner of the ALCS will face the National League champion Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
The game was pivotal as it eliminated Seattle from playoff contention and extended the Blue Jays' postseason run.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He made a fielding error on a transfer throw, allowing a run to score and contributing to the Mariners' downfall.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Baseball player for the Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was involved in a fielding error that allowed him to reach second base, initiating the scoring flow.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that resulted in a fielding error, leading to a run and early momentum for Toronto.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a pivotal moment of the 2025 MLB postseason, the Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series, forcing a decisive Game 7. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the playoffs, extending Toronto’s lead to 5-0 and sealing the win. The Mariners' loss was amplified by three fielding errors — including two in the second inning — which allowed early runs. Pitcher Trey Yesavage delivered strong performance with 31 splitters and limited damage, but the team's defensive breakdowns proved costly. This marks the first time the Mariners have played a Game 7 in their history and the second for the Blue Jays since 1985. The winner of the series will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
